                    Text: 
                    Donate and receive yours!

Hydromorphone



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Dilaudid; Hydrostat; Palladone

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Analgesic; Antitussive

CHEMICAL NAME

4,5-epoxy-3-hydroxy-17-methylmorphinan-6-one

DESCRIPTION

Hydromorphone is an opiate, narcotic analgesic, used primarily in the treatment of moderate to severe pain. It is a semi-synthetic derivative of morphine.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of hydromorphone, an opioid analgesic medication, listing its common and brand names, effects classification, chemical name, and description. It links to related health, legal, dosing, and chemistry information, offers user experience reports, and provides primary and secondary resources for further reading. The section is part of Erowid's Pharmaceuticals Vault, within a broader index of psychoactive substances and relevant resources.
